meanings.definition: The quality or state of being able to be compared.
meanings.sent1: The comparableness of the two cars made it easy to choose the better one.
meanings.sent2: Her essay lacked comparableness, as she failed to provide any points of reference.
meanings.sent3: The comparableness of the two siblings in height was quite amusing to their friends.
meanings.sent4: The comparableness of the situation to a rollercoaster ride was striking.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used a fun game to illustrate the comparableness of different animals' speeds.

meanings.definition: The ability to be likened or equated to something else.
meanings.sent1: The comparableness of her singing to that of a nightingale was remarkable.
meanings.sent2: The comparableness of the two paintings allowed the art critics to draw parallels.
meanings.sent3: The comparableness of his dance moves to a penguin waddling was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The comparableness of the situation to a puzzle with missing pieces was striking.
meanings.sent5: The speaker used a vivid analogy to highlight the comparableness of success to climbing a mountain.
